When I accepted the contract I was on the version before 1.4.  The TR-38-D was given to me as an experimental part and I could see it in the parts list.  After the update I noticed that TR-38-D was no longer a part in the game and I no longer had an experimental decoupler in my parts list.  This is the point where I suspected I had a bug.  I did some research and found that the TD-37 is supposed to be the equivalent, but I couldn't test right away because I didn't have that part unlocked yet.  Now that I have the part, fulfilled all the contract requirements and staged the part multiple times I'm sure that TD-37 is not going to be acknowledged as equivalent to TR-38-D.  What do?

Quote

When I accepted the contract I was on the version before 1.4.

You mean 1.3.1 or 1.3.0?

Quote

After the update I noticed that TR-38-D was no longer a part in the game

The old parts are still there in 1.4.x, change the part view to manufacturer, or decouplers.

3 hours ago, surge said:

You mean 1.3.1 or 1.3.0?

Looks to have been 1.3.1.  I'm running the steam version so it keeps me pretty well updated.

3 hours ago, surge said:

The old parts are still there in 1.4.x, change the part view to manufacturer, or decouplers.

Thank you, filtering by manufacturer helped.   I now have the correct part, but I got the same result when trying to complete the contract as though the part is no longer considered a match for the part listed on the contract.
